html:
Image: Nintendo

Marc Griffin has been an established gaming and entertainment journalist and associate editor since 2019. He has written for the likes of Grammy.com/The Recording Academy, Fandom Gaming, Gamespew, CBR, The Verge, Billboard, JD Sports, XDA, VIBE Magazine, HotNewHipHop, Consequence of Sound, The Face, and more.

Nintendo has done something rare: It put its first-party games on sale! The company’s Summer Sale on digital games through the Nintendo eShop kicked off Thursday and runs through July 9, at 11:59 p.m. PDT.

So, for all the gamers who are in dire need of games for their Switch 2, there are a ton of original Switch games that have received free updates to run on the new hardware, now on sale at discounted prices, like Super Mario 3D World + Bowser’s Fury, The Legend of Zelda: Link’s Awakening, and Super Mario Odyssey. Other first-party games on sale in the eShop include Luigi’s Mansion 2 HD, Xenoblade Chronicles 2 Definitive Edition, Nintendo Switch Sports, Animal Crossing: New Horizons, Fitness Boxing 3: Your Personal Trainer, and Nintendo World Championships: NES Edition.

But wait, that’s not all! A slew of third-party titles, indie and otherwise, are also caught up in the summer madness, with prices so affordable you’ll be asking yourself, “Who needs to eat dinner, when I can finally purchase and never play 30 new games?” So, fill up that backlog with sales on games like Balatro, Hades, Tetris Forever, Metal Slug Tactics, Yakuza Kiwami, Monster Train First Class, Diablo 3: Eternal Collection, Borderlands 2, and more.

Check out a glimpse at some of the games and the prices below:

  • The Legend of Zelda: Link’s Awakening - $42 (original price $60)
  • Super Mario Odyssey - $40 (original price $60)
  • Super Mario 3D World + Bowser’s Fury - $40 (original price $60)
  • Luigi’s Mansion 2 HD - $42 (original price $60)
  • Animal Crossing: New Horizons - $42 (original price $60)
  • Animal Crossing: New Horizons Bundle + DLC - $60 (original price $85)
  • Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder’s Revenge – Ultimate Edition - $23 (original price $33)
  • Xenoblade Chronicles Definitive Edition - $42 (original price $60)
  • The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim Anniversary Edition - $28 (original price $70)
  • Nintendo World Championships: NES Edition - $21 (original price $30)
  • Balatro - $13.49 (original price $15)
  • Everhood 2 - $16 (original price 20)
  • Sonic x Shadow Generations - $35 (original price $50)
  • Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance - $36 (original price 60)
  • Hades - $9 (original price 25)
